Formula:
$ {\Large\int_{a}^{b}} f(x) dx \approx \dfrac{b-a} {2n} {\Large\{} f(a) + f(b) + 2 {\Large[} f(x_1)+...+f(x_{n-1}){\Large ]} {\Large\}}$
$ \text { where } a=x_0 \text{ and } b=x_n $

Formula:
$ {\Large\int} - \dfrac{f'(x)} {\sqrt {1 - (f(x))^2} }  = \cos^{-1}f(x) + c \text{ or } -\sin^{-1}f(x) +c$
$ \text{Note the cons\tant c will have different values with these two options} $

$ {\Large\int} - \dfrac{f'(x)} {\sqrt {a^2 - (f(x))^2} }  = \cos^{-1}\dfrac{f(x)}{a} + c \text{ or } -\sin^{-1}\dfrac{f(x)}{a} +c$
$ \text{Note the cons\tant c will have different values with these two options} $

Comment: Formula can be utilised to calculate otherwise hard to differentiate inverse functions

Description: Recursive definition of an arithmetic sequence
n-th term of an arithmetic sequence
Sum of the first n terms of an arithmetic sequence
Recursive definition of a geometric sequence
n-th term of a geometric sequence
Sum of the first n terms of a geometric sequence
Limiting sum of a geometric sequence

Formula:
$ P(X=x) =  \dfrac{1}{n} 
\text {applies only to uniform proability distributions with n values} $

$ \text{The median of n scores is the } \dfrac{n+1}{2} \text{th score} $
$ \text{if n is even the median is the average of the two middle scores to the left and the right of }  \dfrac{n+1}{2} $

$\text{An outlier is a score with} $
$ \text {   less than } Q1 - 1.5  \times IQR $
$ \text {   or more than than } Q3 + 1.5  \times IQR $
$P(a < X < b) = P(a \leq X \leq b) \text {(for continuous probability distributions})$

$F(x) = P(X\leq x) = {\Large\int}^x_a f(x)dx \text { (for continuous probability distributions, where f(x) is a probability distribution function defined in the domain [a,b] and F(x) is the cumulative density function})$
$f(x) = \dfrac{1}{b-a} \text{ for } a \leq x \leq b \text { (Uniform continuous probability distributions, where f(x) is a probability distribution function defined in the domain [a,b]})$
$P(E) = \dfrac{\text{Number of ways an event can occur}}{\text{Total number of possible outcomes}}$
Permutations with repeated objects: $\dfrac{n!}{a!b!c!}$ where $a+b+c+... \leq n$

$\text{Binomial distribution}: X\sim Bin(n,p) $
$ \Rightarrow P(X=x) $
$ = \bigl({n \atop x} \bigr)p^x(1-p)^{n-x}, x=0,1,...,n$
$\tan \theta = \dfrac{b}{a} \text{ where } \theta \text{ equals arg z in interval } (-\pi, \pi]$
$ |z_1||z_2| = |z_1z_2| \text{ and arg } z_1z_2 = { arg } z_1 + { arg } z_2$
$ \dfrac{|z_1|}{|z_2|} = \bigg| \dfrac{z_1}{z_2} \bigg| \text{ and arg } \dfrac{z_1}{z_2} = { arg } z_1 - { arg } z_2$
$ |z|^n = |z^n| \text{ and arg } z^n = n \times \text{arg z for } n \in \mathbb{Z}$
$ |z^{-n}| = \dfrac{1}{|z|^n} \text { and arg } z^{-n} = \text {-n arg z}, z\ne 0 \text { for } n \in \mathbb{Z}$
$ |z_1||z_2||z_3|...|z_n| = |z_1z_2z_3...z_n| \text { and arg } z_1z_2z_3...z_n = { arg } z_1 + { arg } z_2 + ...+ { arg } z_n \text { where } n \in \mathbb{Z}$
$ \text{ If } z = \cos \theta + i\sin \theta \text{, then } z^{-1} = \overline{z} \text{ (only applies when modulus = 1)} $
$ {|z+w| \le |z| + |w|} \text{ (the triangle inequality where z and w are complex numbers)}  $
$ e^{i\theta} = \cos \theta + i \sin \theta, \text{ where  }\theta \in \mathbb{R}  \text{ (This is Euler's formula and represents the exponential form of a complex number)}$
$ [r(\cos \theta + i \sin \theta)]^n = r^n(\cos n\theta + i\sin n\theta) =  r^ne^{in \theta}$
